results.name: Number T(n,k) of permutations p of [n] having at least one index i with |p(i)-i| = k; triangle T(n,k), n>=1, 0<=k<=n-1, read by rows.
comment: T(n,k) is defined for n,k>=0. The triangle contains only the terms with k<n. T(n,k) = 0 for k>=n.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..35, flattened
example: The 6 permutations p of [3]: 123, 132, 213, 231, 312, 321 have absolute displacement sets {|p(i)-i|, i=1..3}: {0}, {0,1}, {0,1}, {1,2}, {1,2}, {0,2}, respectively. Number 0 occurs four times, 1 occurs four times, and 2 occurs thrice. So row n=3 is [4, 4, 3].
